intro: Silene gallica var. semiglabra, commonly known as the pink campion, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant produces showy pink or red flowers with five petals, arranged in a raceme. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered with fine hairs, though the variety semiglabra has a smoother texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides.
